type: Dismantling of Sable Island Hydrogen Shed
short_summary: The Meteorological Service of Canada operated an Upper Air Station on Sable Island, NS from 1944 to 2019. The contractors will dismantle the building to ground level, strap or containerize the waste material, and dispose of the waste materials on the mainland. There will be no site visit.
description: Dismantling of the hydrogen shed from Sable Island, NS. The project will include dismantling the building to ground level, strapping or containerizing the waste material, and disposing of the waste materials on the mainland. The contractor is responsible for arranging their own transportation to and from Sable Island for personnel, materials, and tools. They must also arrange their accommodations on Sable Island with Parks Canada and coordinate with Parks Canada for logistical support and restrictions. Finally, they must retrieve the materials at the wharf and arrange for their disposal and/or recycling. The estimated value of the project is between $100,000.00 and $200,000.00. , Properties: As found in the JSON object properties:

full_summary:
Dismantling of Sable Island Hydrogen Shed
================================Thanotte

**Notice ID:** cb-7299-53360340
**Notice Title:** Invitation to Qualify
**Notice Type:** 
================ Transport Owned

NOTICE TO CONTRACTORS

### Project Overview

The Meteorological Service of Canada is soliciting offers for the dismantling of the Hydrogen Shed at the Upper Air Station on Sable Island, Nova Scotia. The successful bidder will be responsible for the removal and disposal of the structure, as well as the transportation of waste materials to the mainland.

### Project Specifications

The project will comprise the following activities:

1.  Dismantling of the building to ground level.
2.  Segregation and bundling of waste materials for transportation to Halifax, Nova Scotia.
3.  Disposal and/or recycling of waste materials on the mainland.

### Site-Specific Requirements

Due to the remote location and limited infrastructure of Sable Island, contractors must ensure that they are self-sufficient in terms of personnel, materials, and equipment. Environment Canada has agreed to cover the cost of transporting waste materials from Sable Island to the mainland in the spring of 2024.

### Logistical Requirements

The contractor will be required to coordinate with Parks Canada to ensure access to resources, such as vehicles and equipment, and to plan for any site restrictions.

### Deliverables and Schedule

The project is expected to commence on September 1, 2023, and be completed by March 31, 2024. The estimated value of the project is between $100,000.00 and $200,000.00, excluding taxes.

### Contact Information

Shawn Davis
Contact Information:
Email: [shawn.davis@ec.gc.ca](mailto:shawn.davis@ec.gc.ca)
Telephone: (873) 500-0215

### Download Tender Documents

[Download English Version](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/7299/5000067988_itq_en.pdf)
[Download French Version](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/7299/5000067988_itq_fr.pdf)

**Sealing and Submission of Tenders**

Tenders must be accompanied by a copy of the bid bond and shall be submitted in English or French to Shawn Davis, contact information above. 

### Payment Conditions

Please note that the payment conditions are specified in the tender documents.
